title: Lovely early morning visit.
review: We were at Mukteshwar in the first half of the day on a bright sunny day.  The day was peaceful, but I presume it may get crowded during holidays.  There is a temple atop the hill reachable by climbing about 200 steps from where the car will drop you. Once at the top, the views of the surrounding are breathtaking.  Meals and light refreshments are available from vendors.

title: Oldest temple in Bhimtal Nainital
review: Mukteshwar temple is oldest temple of Uttarakhand . It is 5350 years old temple . The views from the top of the temple are so beautiful and mesmerising .. Great noble winner Robert coach has also been to this temple . Once a visit will embark the freshness and feeling of peace inside .. So visit and feel the inner peace..

title: Beautiful temple with a spiritual/religious reference
review: This temple has a religious significane of pandavas praying here during their vanvas and placing a very old shivling (the locals said as old as 5000+ years old) here. Mukteshwar gets its name from this temple. You have to walk uphill to reach the temple. There is a Ram temple nearby on the right of the main Mukteshwar temple where a Guruji does his prayers. The locals mentioned that this temple has a reference in Mahabharat. Chauli ki jali which is 250 m from the temple is also part of the temple and has another religious belief linked to it (women cross through this on shivratri praying for a child and the belief is that women are then blessed with kids if they are able to cross throught it - read my other review). There are also some local eateries serving rajma chawal, kadi chawal, fresh juice, maggi, tea. I also saw some elderly person who couldn’t walk up to the temple being carried away by some people (in case you have a problem climbing the stairs)

title: SHIVA TEMPLE
review: If you are traveling in Kumaon hills you can plan a stay @ Mukteshwar approximately 70 Kms. from Kathgodam: 55 kms. from Nainital. The temple is situated on a hilltop with scenic beauty all around. Spirituality is in the year one can spend many hours soaking in the peace & spiritual atmosphere.

title: Fair place to visit, but not a must watch
review: I visited this temple after reading a lot of good reviews about it. This temple though  not far off from Nainital, it may take good 3.5 hrs to visit as he roads are quite narrow. The view is scenic, esp the view of Nandadevi peak. Although on google its mentioned that there are fruit orchards, but could see much and the one we saw was all dried. So it is a avoidable visit as this temple of Shiva has got no historical importance, neither the temple is a architectural marvel.

title: Nice place on hills
review: This is a famous tample situated in the outskirts of Nainital... The place is peaceful and divine and a nice tourist spot...

title: Awesome
review: The temple was very good. View from the temple was just awesome. As we visited the temple in a offseason so we enjoyed the nature at its best as it was not crowded.

title: An ancient temple with a great scenic beauty
review: It is an ancient temple dedicated to Lord Shiva

title: Religious visit combined with superb view of Nanda Devi
review: You must visit this temple with the objective of beautiful view of the hills and Nanda Devi. The view of the area around is awesome. Road is not good but inconvenience is worth the time taken because the view is superb and excellent.

title: Nature at its peak
review: Nice trip . The ride takes you to the hieght of 7500 ft. And another climb to 8000ft. The view is great . The road to the top was full of flowers in full bloom . Worth a visit .

title: Awesome views will attract you
review: In June month, got a chance to visit this place. Mukteshwar is the destination which was unplanned for us. We started our trip from Delhi in the morning by 10 am and in the evening by 4, we were at Nainitaal. Then we reached Mukteshwar by 09 PM.

title: Ancient Temple
review: Ratings for an ancient temple is an odd idea but facts are important.

title: Mukteshwar Temple
review: The temple gets its name from from a 3500 year old Shiva Temple,situated atop the heighest point in the town,on the IVRI campus.It holds a big mela on the shivaratri festival.

title: Must visit place
review: Must visit place...!!! You have lot of places to visit where you can enjoy with friends and family..Home stays are superb...!!!

title: God place.
review: Once you come to nainital Uttrakhand

title: Good place but little freaky
review: Good place but little freaky .. off season you can find any tourist there .. only ATM in Mukteswar is located in that place only. You can find local taxi from Mukteswar market .. to reach or personal car ..

title: Scenic  beauty with spirituality
review: This place is amazing... Hard to travel ...however enroute from nainital to mukteshwar is quite picturesque. We loved the place. The temple has its history and itbis also very clean. We loved the place.

title: Beautiful Mountain view
review: The small historic temple which is dedicated to Lord Shiva and is situated on the mountain top. One can reach it by climbing about 90 steps or take hiking route via Chauli Ki Jaali for which you need a guide, or you will not be able to find the track. The mountain view from the temple is mesmerizing.

title: Unforgettable...
review: If you planning a trip to nainital add this place to your trip and this was unforgettable...With positive vibes and fun...

title: Sacred place
review: Must visit for believers in Lord Shiva. Has lots of steps to climb up. But it is worth it for peace and beautiful views.

title: Mukteshwar is peace of mind
review: Route from almora to mukteshwar is breathtaking in final stretch. Do not forget to ask road to temple as u fan easily be misled. Compulsory Take a guide with u to temple. He will take u via trek route with tourist point in between. Also purchase ramfal and lemon on return. Views from temple is simply breathtaking.

title: Temple at 7500 feet
review: In Uttarakhand (devbhoomi) all peaks end at a temple. Mukteshwar is no different. Shiv mandir is famous here. This place is one hour drive (25 km) from malla ramgarh. You will find apple orchards, apricot plants on the way apart from scenic beauties of kumaon hills. Temple is clean and one have to climb 96 steps to reach there. If someone have to avoid steps, from back side of car parking, there is a walkable way without steps going up.

title: Very old temple
review: Mukteshwar temple is very old temple. This is very famous holy place. There are some activities near to this temple. This  place is full of natural beauty.

title: Visited this temple for religious reason
review: Found this temple clean and peaceful with religious values. Not very crowed. You can sit there and feel peace. Also you can have scenic view of mountains from there.

title: Shiva temple atop hill
review: Big temple dedicated to lord Shiva in the woods on the top of hill. Very picturesque view of the valley

title: Best Place for Photography !
review: My stay was in Nainital and We found a tourist Taxi at Mall Road. He took 3000 per car and took us to 5 - 6 places which were included in the package. The last stop was this temple. We took a travel guide who told us about the temple and mountains near it. The mountains near it were so beautiful that it forced me to pick my Cam and shoot it. It is one of the best places near Nainital at which people fond of photography should go. I will like to visit it again.

title: Holy Place
review: The drive to Mukteshwar Temple from Nanital is of around 2.5 hours but worth visiting. The temple is not big but offers good view of the mountains. There are around 100 steps to climb but not tough. Dont miss the local vendors selling fruits and lunch like rice rajma and Kaddi in the lunch.

title: nice views. many people
review: this place seems to be very popular, both with tourists and locals alike. there was so much of a line when we reached the top to the temple that we saw the views and said hello to the gods from outside and came back. but next time i will go inside. the outside seemed just as beautiful.

title: popular Lord Shiva temple
review: Mukteshwar temple is one the most popular and ancient shrines dedicated to Lord Shiva. The temple is settled in a beautiful hill station, Mukteshwar, due to which it is named so.One should must come to this holy spot to get the blessings of Lord Shiva and enjoy the tranquility and scenic beauty of this exotic location.The temple is placed atop a hill, roughly 2312m above the sea level.The presiding deity of the temple is a white marble Shiva Linga and a copper yoni. There are also idols of Goddess Parvati, Lord Brahma and Lord Vishnu are present.

title: Delhi - Mukteshwar - Nainital
review: One of the best hills I have visited.

title: Superb view
review: The temple situated at an altitude of 7500 ft of village Mukteswar...travelling from nainital to mukteswar n gaining altitude is in itself enough for a tourist..one sud visit mukteswar

title: Great
review: It's a temple of lord Shiva located in kanchipuram town. Also named as mukthisthalam of thirukkurippu thondar. If once visited you can know the total story and importance of that place and temple.

title: Mukteshwar
review: Very good place to visit. Situated at very high pick. Distantly located from Nainital. During traveling one will witness apple garden and much more. Better to eat something before going there. Wear winter coats.

title: good place
review: such a beautifull place ...highest place of nainital having one of the oldest temple ...you can also see wild animals like leapord and deer roaming in jungle if u r lucky

title: Bhole nath on hill
review: The awesome place to visti near Nainital,  around 65Kms from Nainital, the Mukteshwar temple, placed on around 8000ft from sea level. This trip requires whole one day from Nainital. Temple it self on height, there are two ways to reach main temple, one is via stairs and one via normal mountain slope, i recommend you should go via second option during climb and prefer stairs during comes down. Because if you choose second option to reach there:

title: Great place to visit
review: it was a great experience to visit this place . the surround n the greens are just awesome. the climate here was cold as it rained earlier. we visited on 4th july 2018. the place offers great peace n great vally view. but i would like to say you all the best season to visit this place is october and november as very one said to us (the locals) as during this months we will be able to see the whole range of himalayas from this spot. the temple is small but good .

title: Around 45 kms from Nainital. Worth visiting
review: This place is around 45 kms from Nainital. You can combine visiting it with Bhimtal and Naukuchiatal. The place is worth visiting, just for the road which leads to it. The drive is enjoyable and when you reach there, the temple and the views around are simply superb. The peace and calmness of the temple make it worth giving the time to visit here.

title: Temple of Lord shiva
review: This mukteshwar temple is around 51 kilometres  from nainital and belongs to lord shiva,very ancient temple.

title: Must Visit from Nainital / Bhimtal to Mukteswar
review: 5350 Years old Shiv Temple  . Started the tour from Bhimtal to Mukteswar. The road is very scenic and beautiful through out the way with Himalayan range. Visit on tea plantain, Ghorakhol temple and few other small temples on the way.

title: Define experience
review: It's in a very pleasant weather region n the road till the last 3 kms  is excellent. The temple is a cluster of smaller temples and 2 to 3 saints are in the venue to do Puja if u wish. It's a min of around 100 steps from the base to the temples. Not very steep and elders can manage it with assistance from family members. Use inexpensive guides for help n information. Several stalls for local lemon juice, fruits, Maggie, n simple veg dal n rice lunch also available at the start of the steps. SBI atm also available 100 mtrs away

title: The Shiva Temple Installed by Pandavas
review: The situation is picturesque as the Mukteshwara is in itself a delightful trip away from Nainital. The Shiva Linga installed by the Pandavas is unique by its ownself, but is ill maintained and overshadowed by the recent Shiva Temple by its side due to the glamour of the recent establishment. The place is very serene and reached after a significant trek up the hill/ steps which ever you choose. A nice surrounding forest has a lot of bird watching opportunity. Take a guide to know better about it!

title: Abode of Peace
review: There is a remarkable air of peace here, especially if One follows the long route and takes the winding path through the woods. The stories are absorbing and the medicinal plants around are very interesting

title: Mukteshwar Temple
review: Mukteshwar is a very small village and offbeat destination. You will find it less crowded even in peak season. The Mukteshwar Temple is 400 meters from main Mukteswar square but you need to climb the hill to reach the temple. It will take just 4 5 minutes if you are fit enough. Once you reach, you will find chilly winds of mountain an ultimate peace amazing view of valley. People want to spend some quality time away from crowed are recommended to be here.

title: MUKTESHWAR TEMPLE
review: Very nice  Lord Siva temple, neat and clean place.

title: Nothing much
review: You travel so much for the temple that by the time you reach their , you are so tired that you don't feel happy because it is small temple and has nothing around to do

title: Mukteshwar nainitaal
review: A must visit place for people visiting nainital. May be taken up as a day trip. Takes around 2 hrs one way from nainital and sites like ghoda khaal mandir (ghanti mandir) and tea garden may be covered on the way. At a height of approx 200 mtrs above nainital, mukteshwar is a bit more chilly and scenic with view of Himalayas.

title: There is nothing in Mukteshwar except the temple
review: Go only for long drive, small tracking and a temple. But the view from the temple is somehow good and there is nothing in Mukteshwar

title: Chauli ki Jali a must trek
review: We loved our 2 km trek along the Chauli ki Jali forest which ended at this temple. We were also lucky to meet the Bengali saint who is the head of the ashram now. A must go place in Kumaon region.

title: This god fulfills all your wishes
review: Yes, people come from all over to ask God Mukteshwar to fulfill their wishes . Once their wishes are fulfilled, they come back to thank God. Such is the faith and devotion. The priest here is known to wear the same simple cotton clothes even in the thickest of winters or snowfall.

title: Up above the world so high!!
review: Lol, dont judge me by the title line.

title: The brave girl
review: Temple is 1.5 hr journey from Nainital. Great view along the road but no snow peak due to dense fog and cloud.Lots of parking space.No entry fee.No maintenance either.Guides cajole to guide you through shorter route to top. Mess of different kinds of eateries.Trek along stairs of moderate difficulty, saw old people as well as 2 year old pious people. Non-descript shiva temple in a jungle .From here you can trek for less than 1 km behind to reach an open space where the conception-famous Chauli ki jali is situated precariously on a stone and actually nothing but a hole. Jagged promontories of stones are called suicide points from where a panoramic view of the surroundings are seen. There are arrangements for rope climbing and here we met our heroine of 4 years who climbed the rope ladder to the top, remained suspended, recited twinkletwinkle from the height and laughed a lot when brought to the ground. This was in contrast to a boy, double of her age, crying vigorously in his turn "papa, bachao!" Ladies, don't come here to achieve CONCEPTION but to LAUGH bravely in adversities.

title: Beautiful and marvelous
review: Very beautiful place to visit. You will feel like that you are in the spiritual atmosphere. If you visit Nainital, than always try to visit this temple

title: Temple
review: It is far away from the nainital. Approx 73 km from nainital. Here is the place for entertainment. Go and enjoy.

title: Nice place to see
review: Small temple & 4 points of view . It is 95 steps away from entrance . Worth going we hired local guide he showed us 4 major points of mukteshwar.

title: People from various regions are visiting these places via Kaladhungi to Nainital and than Nainital to Mukteshwar temple.
review: My experience was one of the best and fully recommend this visit because it will be a combo visit fun with faith.

title: An attractions that needs a lot of work
review: Very poorly maintained with stairs that are a menace.  Trashy with pathetic signage saying not to litter. No signage in English.   Not worth the trip.  My wife is Indian and the little signage does a very poor job of giving background and historical information. Who ever runs the temple complex should be ashamed.

title: Almighty Mahadev Temple
review: Mukteshwar Temple is situated at Chauli Ki Jali,Mukteswar which is around 50 km from Nainital.This temple belongs to Almighty God Mahadev.

title: Spectacular place
review: It is one of the best temples to visit in nainital. One has to trek through jungles to reach there and is at a high altitude. On a clear day one can spot the Himalayan ranges from the top. A sage residing there speaks fluent english and is also a felow of Royal English medicinal practice, now has left everything in life and has settled here.

title: Divine temple!!!
review: The mukteshwar temple was very divine temple.  We went in the early morning. As there was occasion  on that day it was little crowd.

title: Himalayas…………..O My God!!!
review: The Himalayas…………..O My God!!! I finally could see the Himalayas with my naked eyes and the snow blanket spread across. The view just caught my eyes and I could actually feel the cold breezes of mountains.

title: Religious place
review: On top of a mountain, good scenic view, need repairs of stairs. Guide asks for 250 to visit temple without stairs. No need. Only 30+ stairs

title: Mukt eshwar temple
review: Mukteswar temple is the one beautifull temple of area place..mandir is devoted to lord shiva place get crowded the during festival

title: Short vacation
review: Old temple of mahadev. Approx 50 Km from nainital. Roads are good. Must visit place. View from temple is also very good. Can spend some time in temple. You can also buy fruits from out side of temple.

title: Old and nice
review: Such an old temple which is situtated at very height.....but i like it  cause blessing of god are always good....surrounding places are also gud for photography..... :)

title: Crowded + Great Views
review: Mukteshwar temple is always crowded by tourists and locals throughout the year. It's a small hike but once you reach up, the view of the valley is fantastic.

title: a small temple at top of a hill
review: the temple beauty is because of it place .. it give a mesmerising view of deep and large valley...which is amazing ...locally called cholli ki jalli... a must visit place

title: Excellent experience at Mukteshwar
review: I visited Mukteshwar with my wife or one more couple, the hieght of Mukteshwar from ocean to Mukteshwar is seven thousand feet it has a nice view points

title: Temple visit
review: Quite an old temple.  A tourist attraction for Nainital visitors.  The temple run by a Bengali second or third generation priest known as Mukteshwar.

title: Ancient Temple
review: I went to Mukteshwar temple. Mukteshwar temple is an ancient temple which is almost 350 years old. It is situated on the top of the hill in Mukteshwar and lies approximately 2312 m above the sea level. The main deity of the temple is Lord Shiva, and the temple also consists of a Shiva Linga of white marble. It is great place to go.

title: A silent place
review: Lord Shiva temple in a  silent area.  Himalaya view is visible near this temple. Surrounding of this temple have good views

title: Grat views from the top of the temple
review: Chauli ki jali ,just above the temple has great views of the snow mounts and the valley, the temple is ok nothing special.there are small shops outside the temple who sell the local fruits and jams

title: Shiva Temple nestled on the Hill
review: This temple is nestled on a hill top in Mukteshwar. There are two ways to reach the temple. One is to climb the high stairs from the main road. The other one which is more adventurous and less strenuous is the trek going from the back of KMVN Mukteshwar to the Chauli j Jali leading to the temple. The trek is about 250 mtrs and is covered with Lush green trees.

title: A must go place just for the weather in summer
review: We were there this summer with family and kids. It would be advisable if u stay at least 1 night in mukteshwar as otherwise it will be a very tiring day long drive to and from nainital or bhimtal..

title: Nice views of the mighty Himalayas.
review: It was a day visit to the place , not exactly to the temple. Breathtaking views from the top. Good place for birding.

title: Mukteshwar temple
review: This temple could be reached by taking some type of cab or private vehicle.This place could be visited by taking a trip to Ranikhet by cab as the trip to Ranikhet include visiting of this place also.

title: Beautiful Mukteshwar
review: I visited this place to celebrate my wife birthday with one of my friends and his wife. This is beautiful place with great views. After kathgodam take route to Bhimtal for Mukteshwar. We stayed in Cafe Gehna a very good hotel with great food and staff.  Bhalugarh falls,  chauri ki jali and Mukteshwar temple is must visit

title: No words can express the feelings
review: Visit to the Mukteshwar temple is simply awesome. No words can express the feelings. It is so cool & calm and spirituality flows all around. The route to Mukteshwar temple is an experience beyond excitement.

title: Place mixed with spirituality and adventure
review: Temple is at height from where a full Himalayan range is visible, adventure activities are also available there .

title: Awesome place!
review: Mukteshvar Mahadev is an ancient temple located at 8500 feet above sea level.Actually there are temples of lord shiva, shree Ram, Hanumanji and goddess Durga..beautiful place.. 45 km from Naikuchiatal where we stayed..The way to Mukteshvar itself is beautiful.. You can buy fresh fruits like plums, pitches, apples both red and green, apricot while in the way from locals..you can visit apple gardens..there are 2 ways to temple after reaching there..we chose the jungle way to go and stairs to return..there are adventure activities there like zip lining which is thrilling!! The view of the fruit valley from above is wonderful...so must visit place!

title: A secluded hill station
review: Mukteshwar is away from hustle bustle of Nainital and other similar hill stations. Tree are fruits laden, we stayed in a village chokhta which was a small peaceful village with only us as a traveller. All villagers (20 to 30 only) were warm and welcoming. If you are a peace lover, this one is for you.

title: Mukteshwar temple
review: The temple is located on top of a hill and if you are going driving yourself , you are going to enjoy it gking all the way at the top . Its a good temple and a must visit place for all who are visiting uttrakhand . The cold breezes will take away all your tiredness once you reach up there .

title: A normal temple
review: It is a normal temple and not a tourist spot .. one can visit this place for worshipping only .. not much view or tourist thing to do

title: One of the oldest temple.
review: The temple of lord shivji is one of the oldest temple.one have to climb 250 mtr to reach the temple.

title: Nice place at an altitude of 7500 feet.. with excellent views and a small SHIVA temple
review: This place is about 45 Km from Naukuchiyatal and 40 Km from Bhimtal.  The entire drive was really beautiful and with plenty of gardens (apple, apricot, peach, plums and Potato) The weather was bit different during this hot summer.  We were greeted with overcast and fine drizzle.

title: Tourism
review: Very good and charming place,even Road from Nainital to Mukteshwar temple is enjoying trip, and after worshipping Lord Shiva .you have to enjoy Rock Climbing,and a magnificent view of Almora.

title: A simple temple with a good view
review: Need to climb few steps. Mostly tourists not much of a religious scene. High demand in Shivratri (Feb/Mar). Clean and may tie a bell.

title: A Hectic journey to discover few Good Clicks.
review: Initially we thought to get much from this journey but to utter disappointment we get nothing of that sort.

title: Wonderful location of Mukteshwar
review: I have visited Mukteshwar on 26th May along with my family.This location is fantastic,weather was pleasant,we could see other points surrounding the temple of Mukteshwar and enjoyed the day along with my family.Peaceful location.

title: OM Namoh Shivaay!
review: A small, on the top of the hill Shiva Temple.. You can reach Mukteshwar by road from Nainital in 1.5 - 2 hrs. The road is very good and drive is scenic.

title: Great View, Easily Accessible.
review: The ride till mandir was great. The view from mandir is breathtaking. It is on top of a hill and there is a big drop on the side of the hill.

title: must visit
review: we walked up from sitla through the forest-about 3.5 km. a steep walk, but not tough. the journey was as rewarding as destination.

title: Breathe this place..enjoy the super awesome views..
review: Nice temple at the top of mukteshwar hills.. Try and reach by 12ish..

title: Awesome place
review: Chauli ki jali situated behind the Mukteshwar temple is the best place of Nainital.

title: Awesome view
review: Travel is worth it just for the view from the temple. The road travel also is very pretty. Do ensure you have the yummy lime juice and Maggi when u exit from the temple.

title: beautiful
review: this temple is a perfect place to be with yourself.  it is so peaceful to be here.  we really enjoyed visiting and offering prayers here.

title: Clean and Calm
review: This temple is very calm, very well maintained and is not very far from the city. Travellers from around the world are seen here

title: Nice view from temple
review: Temple is very close to Chauli Ki Jali. It is about 350 year old shiv temple. View of valley was nice from the top.

title: Serene is the word
review: Good place. We saw Himalayan range from there. It was 350 kms away from this place, but still visible.

title: Good temple at very high
review: This temple is very good and its on very high so you have to do tracking to reach this temple but the way of the tracking is good and once you reach there you will also enjoy the natures.

title: Gods Own Abode Mukteshwar
review: If you want to get the best view of the Himalayan Range, Mukteshwar is the best place to be. Developed by the British as a research centre, this beautiful place is the home to Lord Shiva, according to mythology. The fruit orchards and the coniferous trees add to the beauty and splendor of this hill station. No wonder Jim Corbett fell in love with the beauty of this hill station. I did enjoy trekking amidst the beauty of this place. Camping is also an option but I thought it was better to avoid, thanks to the severe winter.

title: old temple
review: old shiva temple,  must visit place. but the drive up the hill with lot of curves is a bit tiresome. the views from the top is nice, but no other place to see or activity.

title: Good to visit
review: Nice walk to the temple with view of the valleys and some adventure activities enroute viz. flying fox, rope ladder etc. Taking help of a guide recommended for a easy walk

title: scenic
review: good views of hills,valleys and snow clad himalayas in the distance.worth visiting for good views.There is a small temple ,a recent one without much history but kept clean.near the entrance is a path which leads to view point chauli ki jali ,at a distance of about 250 mtrs from where the above can be viewed.

title: Temple at Height
review: Located about 8000 feet this revered Shiv temple is considered auspicious for many reasons. The location itself is scenic and makes it worth a visit.

title: Nice and peaceful
review: I think that this is probably the highest point of Mukteshwar. The temple is very peaceful and view from temple is awesome with almost 300 degree panoramic. One can sit there and relax and just wonder that why one would not attain enlightenment if there is such a peace to guide your thoughts. Be there and don't just visit spend hour or two to get the real feel.

title: Temple on Hill
review: Temple of Lord Shiva. Surrounding is quit pleasing one, view of mountains from top is awesome. Can see snow fall if went in end of Dec or mid jan

title: Shiva Temple
review: It is on height. you have to walk bit to reach to the temple on the way you can enjoy beauty of Mukteshwar.

title: Feeling Amazed
review: loved the temple as I went there for the first time in the temple and the cleanliness in the temple was simply great

title: Visited from nanital
review: We are starting from morning at nainital from our hotel. We are reaching their in afternoon and come back at evening at hotel. We are watching Himalaya ice moutain , Tea factory on the way. We hire one guide for mukteshwar but so nearest all point and no need any guide. This temple is on hill and we are having good photos their. No any more attraction to see here.

title: Worth a visit
review: Need a long drive from Nainital along Apple orchards, Tea estate and Scenic points through the forest. At the end there is a Shiva Temple prayed to by the Pandavas. Also a Ram Sita Temple and a Devi temple. Walking towards one can see Almora city and the Himalayas on a clear day.

title: Mukteshwar
review: This temple could be reached by taking some type of cab or private vehicle.This place could be visited by taking a trip to Ranikhet by cab as the trip to Ranikhet include visiting of this place also.

title: Beautiful Nature
review: Beautiful Temple known as Ghantewala Mandir  whoever goes to Nainital must visit the Ghantewala Mandir ,u can see the Himalayas with snow, what a beautiful nature.Jai Maa Ghantewali Ki.

title: excellent trek
review: the trek upto the top of the hill to reach the mukteshwar temple is really nice. on a clear day, once can easily see the snow clad mountain ranges in the backdrop

title: heritage temple
review: 1 st we decided to go as it but then took t gauied thank god we did so....he took us another way not from stair....it was beautiful.....very beautiful....15 walk to mandir show all his natural beauty....mandir is heritage.....but t way we reach was good

title: Majestic experience
review: Visited with my friends to this temple. The temple seems well maintained. Unlike other temple ,it's was not crowded and we could directly walk into the garb griha -sanctum. The pujari did a wonderful puja. And yes , this place is absolutely heaven for photography as you can very easily get the first glimpses of snow clad distant Himalayas covered in snow meeting the azure blue sky. What a majestic view!!

title: Old Temple
review: This temple is an old temple and the only famous temple here dedicated to lord Shiva. Other thing that is famous here is Indian veterinary Research Institute.

title: Mukteshwar Outing
review: Hill station for people who like peace, silence and solitude.

title: Amazing Hilltop View
review: Great place to visit. The view from the top of the rock is just amazing. The formations of rocks at the hilltop makes it more beautiful. Gaming activities like rock climbing are available. U gott spend some 5-6 hrs over there. Do have a spicy hot maggi at the hilltop of around 10k ft. The taste of maggi at those places are quite different.

title: Beautiful Hindu Shrine
review: Mukteshwar temple is dedicated to Lord shiva who is the supreme hindu deity.This temple enshrines a white marble shiva linga with a copper yoni.Apart from the sacred shiva lingam,it houses idols of various other deities like Lord Brahma,Lord Vishnu.

title: Great place
review: It feels like you are out of the world when you reach there. Great place to visit. One should go there if like to see nature closely.

title: A Mystique Experience
review: A very nice nd  serene place of Lord Shiva where Pandavas while leaving this world prayed here for their Mukti. Hence the name Mukteshwar.

title: Mukteshwar: The Divine Emancipation
review: Mukteshwar as a place is charming for its old conifer forest, cool comfortable breeze in early October and wide open view of Himalayan range. The Temple is a quiet place, nearly three hundred and fifty years old. As a Bengalee, I was amazed to notice the grave of the first Priest of the temple who came all the way from Halishahar, West Bengal to Mukteshwar and did his best not only for the temple but also for the common folks around.

title: Haven on earth
review: Very  good place for nature lovers,It is on height of 7500 ft', Himalya is visible in the month of october to jan.

title: Nice day trip from Nainital,Bhimtal,Sattal, naukuchiatal,Almora etc
review: At 7500 view is beautiful.there is a Swamiji who stays round the year praying.shiv temple is old & important.place where Pandavas prayed for mukti

title: Top of the Mukteswar, Uttrakhand
review: It's just 200 m far from main Mukteswar circle and you have to take few stairs to reach at the top. from there you can have amazing look of Mukteswar, Choli ki Jali and near by villages. There is a great jungle near temple and can also take leisure walk near temple.

title: Temple in Forest
review: The temple is on hilltop surrounded by Oak Forest. We took a guided tour and saw the nearby attractions and the forest. It need to walk a bit on hill so be in your comfortable clothing and foot wear. It remains closed during winters when it snows.

title: Om Namah Shivay:
review: Located at about 55 kms and at an altitude of 10000 mts a very popular temple dedicated to LORD Shiva.It offers very scenic views

title: Well worth the uphill walk
review: Great views and an interesting temple, small but perfectly formed. Friendly and welcoming to visitors

title: Mukteshwar temple
review: Mukteshwar temple is at a very high altitude. It is a small temple with a beautiful view. You can see the mountain peaks from here.

title: Amazing panoramic view of Nanda Devi peak
review: The Mukteshwar temple provides the best panoramic view of the Himalayas. The snow capped mountains with a cool breeze paints an excellent picture. A must visit while in Nainital.

title: Excellent tourist destination
review: From Nainital only two hours journey Mukteshwar temple can be visited. Senior citizens with knee pain avoid to visit here due to steep climbing approx 150 stairs. From there Himalayan ranges view is awesome. Don't take guide.

title: quite and calm location
review: good location , but more cleanliness is required in temple area, surrounding area scene are beautiful and hours can be spent sitting over here

title: Too Many stairs!
review: there are too many stairs to climb.. temple is ok but the view from there is good. cant spend much time there so I personally was not very satisfied going there

title: Disappointment for cloudy weather.
review: we visited this place but owing to cloudy weather it was rather a disappointment. If you are staying for at least 3 days visit Mukteshwar . You have to hike quite high to reach the temple. Weather may disapprove your wish to witness panchachulli.

title: Quite place
review: The car drive to this temple is bit tough. On the way you see the Apple orchards. The temple is very quite and has spiritual atmosphere.

title: Natural Beauty
review: There is nothing much happening in the Mukteshwar Temple.. it's a small temple.

title: Religious one
review: Muktheswar temple is located near about 70 KM from Nainital. The way by which we went to the place was so beautiful that after every 10 KM we were taking the pics. One should must visit the place.

title: Nice views
review: Very nice views from this place of the mighty Himalayas and the valley, when it is cloudy and you cant see the snow clad ranges, the scene becomes even more mesmerizing and quaint.

title: Hill temple with nice valley views
review: This temple is on a hill around 50 KM from Nainital. Peaceful and calm temple. The valley views are amazing.

title: Excellent View
review: Visiting this temple is worth an experience since it provides excellent view of pictursque mountains

title: Must visit in Mukteshwar
review: It is situated at hill top with wonderful view of valley.The track to temple is refreshing.Adventure activities are good.

title: Scenic road & Location..hill top...Divine place
review: It is around 50 kms from Nainital and as such a half day tour. There is a small temple on the pine tree hills. The road to the place is scenic and you enjoy through. The temple is situated at hill top and one needs to be climb around 150 plus steps to reach there and hence elders with knee or climbing issues are suggested. It is a ancient Linga (Mahadev) . The place is serene and you get a very good view of mountains and valleys from here. You would definitely like to click some photos from here. There is also a small Ram temple in a cave here. When we went inside there was Rishi who was giving sharing some stories from mythology with locals. Your tiredness would be gone when you reach this place. You can get the local fruit "Kafal" while climbing up and do enjoy it.

title: awesome place
review: this temple is also a kind of huge and made by some historic personalities and the beauty of this temple is awesome/

title: Great temple with a playful drive
review: This temple is situated 35kms from Bhowali and we had a good playful drive to this place.

title: only place to go in mukteshwar
review: Being the only place to go in mukteshwar everyone throngs to the place.

title: Nice Temple
review: Nice temple at Mukteshwar.One has to climb few stairs. Initial climb might feel tiresome but it is not that difficult. You also get to see good views from the temple on a clear day.

title: One of the best view of the Himalaya's
review: Mukteshwar is about 10 hours from Delhi. It is at a height of above 7000 metres.

title: Shiv Mandir- Om Namah Shivay
review: Beautiful Shiv Mandir to visit at a height of 2800mt., also visit Choli ki Jaali near the mandir. this is the only place to visit in Mukteshwar.

title: Best Place to see Himalayas in Mukteshwar
review: The Temple is at very quite place you can actually feel the beauty of nature n peace their. it has its own heritage importance. avoid stairs to reach their while coming back you can use stairs.

title: Nice view point from here
review: Its a good 2 hours drive from Nainital. There is a good view from behind the temple. Hired a local guide for 200/- and he took from a slightly different route explaining about the history of the temple, the trees etc..Its worth it.

title: A serene gate-away.
review: Located 40 kms uphill from Nainital town. This is a must visit place. Colder than nainital because of its location which is at more height than nainital. Amazing view of hill when you are reaching here via road. Reaching the temple is kind of a small trek. When you reach here you can feel the gushing of wind on your face and hear its sound. Walk to the temple seeing the view of hills from that height. One can view the snow capped mountain in the if the day is clear. Go and worship in the temple. View from the temple is mesmerizing and it is very peaceful up there with you and you alonel. You can also do some sports activity up there. While getting down you can eat mountain fruits, Maggie, pakodas etc. which tastes real good. It will take a half day to visit this place. Once you come here you won't  feel like leaving.

title: Spiritual Place
review: Excellent place  to worship god and spend the time in meditation. Very beautiful temple and surroundings. approx 2 hrs drive from Nainital this is wonderful place to visit.

title: Rewarding trip with a different adventure altogether
review: Full on 2 hour drive from Nainital to reach Mukeshwar. It houses religious place of Lord Shiva. It has got beautiful landscapes to offer like adventurous rope sliding on cliffs.

title: very old mukteshwar temple
review: hii we group of friends go there.such a very old temple .so far .we tired to go there..we go there when we are so near that place

title: Heights of divinity..
review: Well you do have to travel a bit as it is located far from the main city. We booked a cab and took almost an hour to reach the temple. The temple itself is located on a mountain side so after parking ur car be prepared to climb a flight of stairs upto the main door of the temple. However its not that bothersome and the back side of the temple provides with a raring gust of wind and a breath taking view of the mountains..

title: Must visit
review: a trip to naini is incomplete without visitng this place, if you are a religious person then this is a must visit plaec

title: Nothing much t o talk about
review: Very average temple! Not much maintainece done. Offers good view of the place though. The maggi point and rajma chawal vendors on your way to the temple are good eating joints specially in a good weather. Definitely buy plums as much cheaper than what you get them in delhi.

title: Mukteshwar temple visit
review: Beautiful lush green , pollution free , silent place. Worth visiting for nature lovers. Can keep walking and walking and enjoy pollution free fresh air.

title: Good Place
review: its Very spiritual place. You can feel pollution free air in temple. Nice Scenery to watch. Good view as its on high from nainital

title: Load Mahadeva Temple
review: This is the calm place in Nainital.It is 3 hours drive from Nainital. Although I didn't find The Chholi ki jaali which is at the back of this temple as worthy enough to travel.

title: Guide says Pandavas were there 5000 years ago.
review: Very nice temple at almost 7000 feet. Very cool place but the temples is the usual type... Good to have taken a guide to take for a short trek into the surrounding forest and explained the history of the temple which was erected 500 years ago and where Pandavas stayed for some time 5000 years ago.

title: Mukteshwar temple of Lord Shiva.. Must visit
review: Mukteshwar temple is located at an altitude of above 7000 ft.

title: Mukteshwar maha dev
review: Mukteshwar mahadev is a temple of lord shiv. Its situated at second highest mountain of UK. I love this place bcoz of its scenic view and the way to mukteshwar is very good. Lots of apple tree were there. Overall a good place to visit there.

title: General review
review: Must visit Forrester people going to Nainital. It's 50 Km away but believe me it's worth going there. Rather take a night halt there. The beautiful sunrise from Himalayan mountains will leave you mesmerized.

title: Mukteshawar is known for Indian Veternary Research Institute.
review: Mukteshwar is situated at an altitude of 8000'  in Kumaon Hills. The place is surrounded by Oak and Chir Forests. The longest range of Himalayas can  be seen from this place. Lord Shiva    Temple is known as Mukteshwar Mahadev.

title: Har har Mahadev
review: A very nice road trip to Mukteshwer which is at a higher altitude than Nanital.  Took blessings of Shiv ji.

title: Excellent temple
review: Very religious place. You have to climb some 90- 100 stairs.

title: Fabulous place!!!
review: Mukteshwar temple is one of the major attractions in Mukteshwar hill station. Mukteshwar got its name for a 350 years old Shiva temple. Lord Shiva is considered as the lord of salvation- mokshya in Sanskrit which is called mukti in local language, thus the name Mukteshwar- who provides mukti (salvation). Besides this, Chauli ki Jali in Mukteshwar is popular for rock climbing. At Chauli ki jali, one can enjoy the beautiful scenery. It is an ideal place to observe eagles and other feathered hunter birds- tourists can see them diving down at their prey.Trekkers will love to pay visit to the temple.Nanda Devi, Nanda Kot, Nandaghunti, Trishul and Panchachuli are some of the major peaks visible from Mukteshwar. One one side Mukteshwar is covered by dense forest and on the other side it offers splendid view of the enchanting valley and the Himalayas.Overall had a nice experience here.

title: Too good place
review: It's really nice place to be there with friends and spend some time out from busy working schedule.. total population of 250 people, untouched and peaceful..

title: Bliss and Pure Air
review: A must visit for Nature Lovers with a tinge of spiritualism. The oak forest and apple orchards with vine roses and other exotic flowers on the way, make your trip to this place worthwhile.

title: Worth visiting place near Nainital
review: Mukteshwar temple- though visible from the telescope at the Snowview Point in Nainital- is a must visit place if you are in the vicinity. a good drive through some scenic hilly route takes you there. The environs are serene and calm. The best way to approach the temple is through a narrow track from Chauli ki Jali which gives you some glipmses of the jungle as well.

title: For the Religious Minded Only
review: The temple itself is well maintained and clean. But not much to see by way of architecture. Nearby there is a point from where the view is spectacular. For the adventure seekers  facility to do rappelling and other such activities. But we did not consider the three hour drive from Nainital to be worth it. So, strictly for the religious minded.

title: A very common temple
review: The temple gets unnecessary importance . The steps to the temple are difficult for the disabled and seniors. It is a Shiva temple that one gets at every corner. Yes the view from the top is very beautiful , but again, that also is available at every turn in Himalayan ranges. The Tourism dept, has just increased one point of visit for the outsiders.

title: Lord Shiva Temple...
review: This is the most serene place in Nainital...It is 3 hours drive from Nainital...It is a must visit place...The Chholi ki jaali at the back of this temple is the best place for photography freak people...

title: Shiv Ji Temple
review: This is the most serene place in Nainital..

title: cool and calm
review: one can enjoy the serenity in the lap of nature. Highest place of Nainital. Turnings on the Roads are very dangerous.

title: MUKTESHWAR MAHADEVA TEMPLE, 200 years old must visit.
review: Visit this temple with faith !!!  Result is always there !! Best part

title: Quiet and Amazing Place- Shiva Temple
review: This is the most amazing place in Nanital. there are many stairs to reach this temple. Its a very small old temple. Choli ki jaali have best view. its a old caption that ladies who dont have kids can cross inside th choli ki jaali can help . ..

title: Thrilling !!
review: When you'll reach at the gates you'll think what a bore place we landed here but once you started towards the Temple at the top you'll sure think that it requires more oxygen to inhale than you thought. From the side railings of the temple you can get a view of mountain & valley landscapes along with the choulli ki jaali a place famous for mountain sports activities.

title: Amazing Mukteshwar Dham
review: Situated around 50 kms from Nainital... this is a place to be. Public transport was not good for reaching this place. Few buses go to this place and they take too muct time. That is the reason why I would suggest to visit this place by taxi. By taxi also it would take around 2 hours to reach here and there are few places in transit also like Ghorakhaal Temple, Tea gardens etc. So it will take roughly half day for this place.

title: Mukteshwar
review: We trekked all the way from bhatalia to mukteshwar temple. It was a very nice walk across the huge pine trees meeting locals enroute. The temple is serene and divine. The surrounding places offer very good views of the nearby hill statatins as well as himalayan ranges. A nice place to spend a day.

title: it's not for temple it's for the ride
review: This ride in hills with chilled breeze will make your words go poetic, after every turn you'll see the water falling of the hills not huge ones still their presence counts.

title: A must to visit while in Mukteswar
review: It is in the hill top. Trecking route, not tough is available from KMVN guest House. You may go by car also. Go for seeing sunset. Also visit the Circuit House at the entrance of the Temple. It is famous for Jim Corbett.

title: Tremendous energy at Mukteshwar
review: The Mukteshwar temple is awesome. It has incredible beautiful energy. There is also a beautiful walk around the temple thru pine woods and then it overlooks a huge valley

title: Religious Place; High Altitude Sports like Paragliding/ Mini Zip Lining; nice View
review: Say Namaste to Mukteswar Baba; Take a walk around the temple through the woods; Stop and take a View of the settlement below,The himalayan Range at a distance; If interested, take the zip line lasting a minute or so; go paragliding; Overall good.

title: Nice Place
review: Mukteshwar Temple is nice quaint temple. After visiting the temple one can visit Choli ki Jaali a view point. On way back one can have delicious maggie and tea. Beware of the Monkeys.

title: A must visit place around Nainital
review: When in Nainital, one must visit Mukteshwar Temple. The scenic beauty on way is very unique. Mukteshwar temple is an ancient temple and as per legend Pandavas spent one night during their Agyatwas. Few manageable steps lead you to the temple. One must spend an hour in silence at the temple to rejuvinate.

title: Godly
review: One should not miss out on visiting the Mukteshwar temple while visiting the surrounding areas. You would be as peace while in the temple.

title: Every penny worth  your time and money
review: You need have a full day for this temple tour ex-Nainital and believe me it's worth it.

title: good drive and temple
review: If you have a time crunch, you can skip for a tour of lakes or so.. after nearly 2hrs of one way drive from Nainital, may not be worth...but good surrounding, drive, temple atmosphere, view, etc.

title: Old Shiva temple
review: This is a old Shiva temple.worth visit for first time.There is not much to see except temple.however u can spend some time by roaming around & having tea/maggie.

title: A very serene and beautiful place
review: Mukteshwar dham is a small temple which is very serene place with with beautiful veiws all around. A walk in the woods nearby is a good experience. Took a guide who took us in and around temple including Chaula ki Jali.

title: At 2200 meters. Peace.
review: Went their from nainital 53 km.

title: Nice visit to Mukteshwar temple
review: An excellent place shouldn't be missed if you visit Nainital. The temple is at a panoramic view point and the view of Himalayas is great from here.

title: Must visit place
review: situated 55km away from nainital but worth visiting place. Chauri ki Jaali view is awesome. Must take a guide alongwith (Rs 120) for a detailed tour. You can see beautiful view of Himalaya peaks in mornings

title: A Good Place to visit
review: Mukteshwar is quite far from Nainital, temple is located on top of hill. It gives you a divine experience, to reach the temple you have to gone through a small trek.

title: Interesting old temples
review: Mukteshwar Dham (as it is called locally), there are two temples that can be accessed by walking along steps under dense forests. There are bells in the temple and the priest explains the history of the temple and Mukteshwar. A tranquil place in the forests.

title: Divine !!!!
review: Have to trek to hill top for reaching the Temple. For old people (from plains)it is difficult but not impossible.  On reaching it gives you a divine feeling. Basically Lord Shiva Temple having other Gods idol too.  Very calm & peaceful

title: Must visit
review: The road ends!! Blissful plc , sunset, nanda devi, trishul and Panch chulli ranges on a clear day, no mall road , peaceful and  serene. I hope all the construction around doesn't kill the place in future.

title: Best views of the valley
review: A good road trip from Nanital, Mukhteshwar is about 2 hours journey from Nanital. You will come acroos magnificent views of Himalayas if you are lucky and it is not cloudy/foggy. Mukteshwar temple is surrounded by a forest which has a small trek of about 15 mins to Choli ki jali which has the best views in this valley.

title: Peaceful Temple
review: Very Peaceful temple near the area. There is a different type of peace in the temple. Beautiful Temple.

title: Amazing trekk to Mukteshwar
review: A must visit while you are in Nainital. It's 51 km from Nainital. Plan well. Include other places in your itinerary. A breathtaking view of Himalayan range you'll get while going to Mukteshwar. Go to Choli ki Jali once you are at the temple premises. Have a small trek to choli ki jali and then go the temple from behind through the jungle. Try to reach there by 9 am. You'll love the trek.

title: Nice place to visit
review: Nice little temple. Very near to Tourist rest house mukteshwar. there are to approaches to the temple. A view point in addition to a place of worship.

title: Serene
review: Nice quiet place with a bengali baba maintaining the temple. also have a nice walk through the jungle terrain

title: A temple tucked at the remote end of Uttarakhand...
review: Beautiful location and amazing scenery from the top. If you manage to visit the temple on days when "tourists" are not there, the silence around will amaze you.

title: Reach temple after trekking
review: The temple is situated at a height but its boring to climb the stairs to reach the temple. The bes option is to go on trek around the temple (ask for the way to Chauli ki Jali to ppl there) and reach the temple after seeing the beauty around it. There is nice vie of mountains and roads from the temple.

title: Stunning views of the Himalayas from Mukteshwar
review: Mukteshwar got its name from a 350year old temple Mukteshwer Dham whose presiding deity is great Lord Shiva. The top of the mountain on which Mukteshwar Dham is stood offers stupendous views of Himalayan range. Mukteshwar was developed by the Britishers as research and education institute by setting up Indian Veterinary Research Institute (IVRI) in 1893.

title: small temple. refreshing view.
review: it just like normal temple. the view behind temple is beautiful..

title: Its a not a temple, its a dhaam
review: If any point of time you plan to visit uttarakhand, you have to visit this place. Beautiful temple with breathtaking views.

title: 350 year old Shivji Temple
review: Mukteshwar temple is supposed to be 350 years old and is been situated atop the highest point in the town. Behind Mukteshwar temple is Chauli ki Jali which gives view of Himalaya in the month of Oct Nov. You can have the activities like rock climbing and valley crossing.

title: Must Visit Place
review: It is as 8000 Feet. On the way from Nanital to Mukteshwar you find   Apple Orhards and Breathtaking view. Peopl plan their weekend to stay in Mukteshwar just to relax and rejuvenate. A peaceful Hill Station

title: Mukteshwar - Jun 2015
review: The place is serene. The temple is at some height and you have to take some stairs to reach the temple. Some part is little steep, so need to be watchful while coming down. It is a lord Siva temple. From the top, the view is also good. Best part is you go, visit the temple, offer your prayers and nobody is chasing you how much money you have to pay for your prayers.

title: At Peace
review: Lovely feeling being there and just meditating forgetting everything around.

title: Journey is reward in itself...
review: We drove down from Nainital allured by the promise of snow clad mountains and it is indeed a brilliant drive with scenic landscape and enchanting flora and fauna. Though the snow clad mountains eluded us, as there were lot of clouds on the horizon, we still loved the place. The temple premises are not exactly very clean or inviting but the location is beautiful and warrants a visit even if you are not inclined to visit the temple. Some fresh produce from the area is available and some good restaurants on the way as well. I was told October is a good time to see the HImalayas...

title: Om Namah Shivaya
review: Its on top of hills and a must see place for everyone. Either go in morning or book hotel before going as there are very few options to stay and very costly also. A good holy place to worship. Below temple there is one adventure point also where we can see a hole in a mountain and that is the place where you can ask god for a wish and people say that it will be accepted by god very soon.... so its good for everyone with peace of mind and adventure too

title: Amazing place
review: Breathtaking view. Wonderful place to capture pics with your loved ones. Give this place a try, you won't be disappointed.

title: Try taking help of a Guide  at a very reasonable price...it will be very usefull.
review: Besides Spiritual fulfillment the place is just AMAZING as far as natural beauty is concerned. It is MUST visit place.Donot miss it.

title: very good place
review: One of the best places in India. The temple and surroundings are really must see.

title: Adventours Place
review: Its just awesome place as the view is good we havce to reach temple so thr are two ways either you go from stairs or you take a long way but the area view is good you can see snow point also

title: Mukteshwar Temple
review: Very Nice Temple of Mukteshwar Mahadev. if you hire a local guide outside the temple for 100 Rs. he will give you tracking up to temple. You can see various plantations during the tracking.

title: On top of the world
review: The temple is perched atop a small hill and offers breathtaking views all around.  You can see chauli ki jali from the temple and see people climbing up to the edge of the hanging rock. Pristine, serene off beat destination

title: Great place for worship and photography
review: It's religious place and Lord Shiva's temple situated approx 45 Kms from Nainital mall road. Roads are okay. While driving down to this place you will come across Gorakhaal Sainik school and Cantt. area. The nature around this place is amazing the trees are full of apple and apricot. If you happen to see an Orchid do pay a visit. There are hotels nearby and not very expensive as compared to main Nainital. This place is not very crowdy therefore one  can come here for peace and worship. The small but popular Temple is many years old and is situated and top of mountain peak. There are 100 odds stairs to climb. Near by temple is a place called as Chaulee Ki Jaali. It's round shape hole on a mountain peak. It's said those females who look beyond this place are blessed with a child. I don't know how true is that. One can also enjoy rock climbing nearby here and take good photographs on these rocks at the highest peak. We hired a guide namely Chandra Prakash. He know the area really well. Do pay a visit.

title: PLACE OF SERENITY AND PEACE
review: This is a very old temple in the midst of dense forest. This temple has great history. So, please do thorough research before visting this temple.

title: sceneric point
review: Peaceful and prayerful place. Feel peace of mind. Lot of people, but still peaceful feeling . Some majestic environment.

title: Mukteshwar near nainital
review: Its just beutiful but roads are narrow. Yoi have to take an expert driver. You will find fruit laden trees on roadside. View of valley is breathtaking

title: "Execellent natural scenes"
review: The road from Nainital to Mukteswar is quite narrow and risky. There is no barricade at the borders of the road. Only expert driver can drive. On the way, we visited Ghodasal temple. It is quite awesome. One should not miss this. On the way we found Kumaon fruit gardens and tea garden at Bhowali.The final point, near Mukteswar temple is quite thrilling. It is 8000 ft high from sea level. The natural beauty is fantastic. One should enjoy flying fox adventure game. Every one should take precautions while taking snaps , sitting on rocks. They are not protected by barricades. So chance of accident is very high.The temple is very nice. Definitely, one should visit this point.

title: Cold & Calm!
review: Mukteshwar is said to be the top most point of Nainital and its sister hills. As one goes round about the hills reaching this place it gets extremely chilling and moist. You can play soft music(something from the 90's maybe) and drive through the dense jungles that parrallels the roads from both sides. One can stops at multiple points offering great views to the deep valleys and can easily trace the roads taken to reach that very point. Its majestic and surreal!!! Its gets isolated as one reaches the top and the tranquility that follows is a thing that zen books boasts of. The surrounding would set one up in a meditative mood and the fragrance of the apple orchards would instantly trigger up your appetite!!!

title: Simple Mandir
review: Mukteshwar is a place 55 km from nanital famous for only one mandir Mukteshwar Mandir. The mandir is known for getting Mukti. It is a simple mandir with few long steps . Guide prefer to take you from outside showing the chauthi jali (a hole in the hill) and by showing some medicinal plants at  the back of the mandir. Mandir is not very great point . Mukteshwar has no other tourist spot and one has to return immediately after seeing the mandir.

title: visit for the himalyan view
review: do visit mukteshwar temple for "himalayan views'if the skies are clear-not for the moeny oriented self styled pandas -ther is one "saint" in the temple complex atop the hill who claims he is 165 years of age and lives 6km underneath the mountain in the winter season-this saints kuti is fittted with cable tv modem computer etc. etc.-on entry take the downhill road which takes you to the backside of temple atop the cliff have beautiful views of the valleys and himalyan ranges then turn to the second route to the temple.do have a cup of tea at ;JOSHI TEA STALL"

title: Superb location... great views!
review: The Gods always choose the best spots when it comes to being on hills! After offering prays to the lord, a bit of sight seeing around will further lift you up.

title: Very pretty!
review: It was quite a climb but the temple was clean & welcoming. So many bells of faith hanging there, waiting to be rung. The view was spectacular & the pandit Ji told our kids to stay away from electronic devices!!! Later, we went to the adventure area near the temple where the kids tried tree rope climbing & archery. The walk was through a pretty forest area. There was also rappelling. Lots of fun.

title: Feel the Himalayas
review: Stay at mukteshwar at least two nights better three. Enjoy himalayan charm from the sunrise to the sunset. All the giant peaks of kumayun will be your feast of eyes. The mukteshwar temple is very nice. Siuated calmly amidst of mountains and jungles. Trek around the temple to see other spots through a jungle trail. You may visit Nainital and other tals staying at mukteshwar to avoid Nanital congestion. I suggest a weekend trip at mukteshwar is realy worthy particularly late Jan to March if you can enjoy the cold. Snow fall is almost sure in late Jan. You can get rhododendrons locally called buranches in the late season. You may take buranches products like squash, jam etc to your home. Claim is that they may have some medicinal value.

title: Average Place
review: Can visit if you have completely spare time. Otherwise not advisable to waste your five hours. Himalaya is visible only if weather is clear

title: a heavenly experience
review: the kmvn mukteshwar is a luxurious experience. delicious food ,couteous staff and the enchanting ranges of nanda devi trishul pindari and panchchauli glacier are a treat for your eyes. the place in the early morning gives u serenity tranquility,feelings close to nature by trekking on kuccha roads ..it was a delightful trip.

title: Mukteshwar Shiva Temple
review: The place is far away from Nainital as it is almost three hour journey by road. The isolation of the temple from human habitat gives the temple an extra edge. There is no hue and cry of human beings except for few tourists and some locals. There is a research center in the vicinity of the Temple.

title: Average temple after a stiff climb of quite a number of stairs
review: Mukteswar is about 50 km away from Nainital town. This temple is a very ordinary looking temple but the journey from Nainital town is a breathtaking with apple, pear orchards, apricot gardens and mighthy snow peaks of Himalaya on the way. Just behind the temple is "Chauli ki jali", which is a must visit. The journey can be wonderful at winter

title: small temple on hill top
review: 90 steps to a small temple adorned with bronze bells and a nice view. You can see Gray langur mothers with their children. There is also a spot where which you can slide over a valley hanging by a rope

title: Chauli ki Jali
review: Just below the temple is a view point over jutting out rocks called Chauli ki Jali and a must visit!

title: Adventure sports
review: The temple is nice, and very mystic, some activities nearby are  rockclimbing, and rappling. The height of the temple is such as you would feel on top of the world, and on clear days 360 degree views of the majestic Himalayas are there. the entire temple region is covered by dense forests, and we trekked for sometime just enjoying every part of it.

title: Small temple at 2200 metres  - Great views
review: We decided to visit Mukteshwar when we were going from Ranikhet to Nainital. We took a long detour of 40 kms and we were not disappointed. The place is located at one of the highest peaks out of neighbouring mountains and you can feel the cool breeze continously flowing. Just behind the temple there are some rocky cliffs which offer great view. Must go there. Do take a guide - they charge around 200 bucks but they will show you different places and make your little trek very interesting.

title: Majestic view of the mountains...
review: Mukteshwar has an ancient Shiva temple...and on the backdrop of the forest and mountains its a great place to visit.

title: Mukteshwar
review: This place has an ancient temple which is quiet popular.viewof thevalley below is worth capturing.Road from Ramgarh toMukteshwar is good and the rideis enjoyable.this place alsooffers para gliding

title: journey lovers
review: 20 kms away from nainital,we took a taxi and went.The scenaries are amazing when you go up.Enjoy the place by stopping in the route for watching through binoculars,taking pictures.It is advisable to take something to chew as one can face ears pressure.

title: stunning view and peaceful place
review: one should hire a guide there who are easily available once you reached there. They charge Rs 200/- only and take photos also from your camera/mobile. It is good to have guide. He explains about the plants and different usage of herbs, help you to explore forest around the temple so that you can experience the stunning view.

title: Long Drive from Nainital
review: We in India believe that by making a Temple on top of of a Hill will make a good tourist destination.... Nothing really great about this temple or the drive from Nainital. I was told there are Apples and Plum orchards on the way. Did not find any that were really exciting. I feel can be avoided unless you are really travelling that side for some other purpose.

title: Temple on the hill
review: It's a goos climb....and read the history before you go...so that it helps one understand the historical importance.

title: More than temple its the place which should be visited
review: I visited this place some time back and few visitors visit this place therefore it is not very crowdy. it was a nice place to visit. there is not much to see except the point, which is probably high point of a mountain, from where you can see the himalyan range and of course this temple but i cannot say anything special about any temple  . . its just faith. my guide told me that females who are unable to bear child come here for praying. its better to go by taxi as bus was not frequent and you can enjoy in between also. if you are going to nainital then do take a tour bus and enjoy lots of places ;) happy journey.

title: Heavenly Abode in True Spirit - Mukteshwar Dham
review: Distance from Nainital to Mukteshwar is around 50 -55 kms. You will be passing through narrow roads of hills, drive through the hills was a feast to eyes, inspiring our senses, felt warmth of mother nature, At Mukteshwar, you will have breathtaking view of hills, valley & Mica granite. There are villagers who offer guide services at nominal fee of Rs 100/-. You can walk through the narrow path & plantations of dev dhar & enjoy the beauty of mother nature. There are rock formations, adventure activities like soft trekking, rock climbing & rapelling among others at fee of Rs 400/- per head. Temple premises is so peaceful, felt like just sitting there for few hours, water at temple is so pure & sweet, could not resist myself drinking directly from tap though was very cautious during entire trip. Suggest mode of travel is to hire a cab, travel time is around 2 hrs & if you plan to spend some time than you must carry food as you will not get anything at temple. Also was told by guide that during Dec & Jan there was snow fall of 5 feet at this temple town. Temple witness 15000 - 20000 piligrims during Maha Sivarathri festival as informed by guide

title: A quaint temple with a great view
review: This is 51 km from Nainital and about 7,500 ft high. The road journey itself is enjoyable with scenic views. At the temple, we engaged a guide to help us  see all the sights. We got very good views of the surrounding mountains, forests and valleys. The temple is on a forested hill and is good to visit.

title: Very nice and clam place...
review: Mukteshwar gets its name from an 350-year-old temple of Shiva, known as Mukteshwar Dham. Its small but very beautiful and awesome location. Apart from the temple place is also famous for its suicide point , but even that point also have a very good view from the top of the peak.

title: Visit to Holy places
review: As we call Uttarakhand as Dev Bhoomi , place where God is there , we planned a visit to Bhimtaal , Ramgarh and finally reached Mukteshwar , good altitude , very scenic place , lot of mica available as a natural resource , beautiful though not maintained holy temple , campus of Indian veterinary  research institute is around , lot of hotels are there though not very good ones , but recommended for visit if not stay , you can plan to stay in Ramgarh

title: Please Visit....
review: Shiv temple ....you'll have to climb up for the darshan...but I must say what a beautiful place...when we went to temple it was raining ....dark cloudy....was not able to stand because of rain and breeze was playing with us.....beautiful drive odd 50 km from Nainital but worth it...

title: Place worth visit once
review: Temple per se is a small and old temple but for little me time, one can visit Mukteshwar. I have visited this place thrice and would like to visit again.

title: Ghanty wala mandir
review: it is loketed very high. but we enjoyed to go. most of people come there with Mannat. So many applicotions are there. un countable Ghanties. But the peace there must be an attraction

title: Mukteshwar temple
review: Mukteshwar gets its name from an 350-year-old temple of Shiva, known as Mukteshwar Dham, situated atop the highest point in the town, on the veterinary institute's campus. Close to it lie the overhanging cliffs, locally known as Chauli-ki-Jali, used for rock climbing and rappelling, with an excellent view of the valleys below. The sunrise point is at the government-run PWD guest house. One can also visit the Indian Veterinary Research Institute (IVRI). Mukteshwar is the abode of a saint — Shri Mukteshwar Maharaj ji — who lived at the Top Cottage Temple where his samadhi is. One of his disciples, Swami Sanshudhanand ji, now stays there. The whole temple complex is a Tapovan and an ideal place for meditation.

title: Serene & highly spiritual
review: Place is quite n highly spiritual. one can find good home made food nearby. Its mostly raining here so an umbrella is a must. One could see really old trees with a thick layer of moss over them. Simply amazing!

title: nice temple
review: if you are going to mukteshwar this is the place it has been named after. so it becomes a must visit. the temple is at a height so it is not good for the people who cannot walk or rather climb stairs. there are about 70-80 stairs. also there is a way that leads you to this place called chauli ki jali where you can enjoy really thrilling sports

title: calm and beautiful
review: About 2 1/2  hours drive from Nainital  about 52 kms on the north east is the hilly isolated place. There is wonderful view point of Himalayaas and a small temple dedicated to lord Shiva.

title: Mukteshwar Mahadev
review: Mukteshwar Mahadev mandir is the highest point in Mukteshwar. This famous temple is said to be more than 300 years old.It is the best place for  meditation loving people.You can see 360 degree view from this temple. After the visit of this temple the best place to relax is Red Chilli Restaurant in Mukteshwar where one can enjoy the excellent food.

title: nice place to see near nanital
review: very nice place to go in day time,,,a good view of himalya from mukteswer temple,,,must see this place,,,enjoyed a lot

title: Awesome Place
review: We went to Mukteshwar Temple from Nainital and it took around 2 hours to reach there through a local taxi. You can find couple of scenic views on the way to Mukteshwar. Must go there.The walk to the temple and the temple itself is just amazing. Make sure you book a reliable guide. Mukteshwar Mahadev mandir is the highest point in Mukteshwar.

title: It is wonderful site to visit.
review: The temple is small but very good peaceful. you must visit the Dak Bunglow sit which is very close to this temple. From the Govt. Dak Bunglow site the views of Himalaya peaks are wonderful. Must visit place. It is opposite to KVMN rest house.

title: Only if you are devout
review: It's in a beautiful location, and up on a hill, so you are likely to enjoy the visit. But the temple itself has all the problems of big temples in India: crowded, overrun by seriously non-holylooking priests and their sidekicks, and not particularly clean. Personally, I enjoyed the walk around the temple, to the adventure sports point and around the hill through the little wood, much more than the temple itself. But I guess it depends on how ritualistically inclined you are.

title: The Only Place worth Fallin in Love in Kumaon Hills
review: Although nainital is like a two hour drive from my home town but it is only this june i visited mukhteshwar for the first time. I found it to be the most loved jewel nestled among the kumaon hills. I would suggest to go their by a bike if you really want to enjoy on the way from nainital. Although we stayed at Bhowali but we went to mukhteshwar by car, while in car i felt that a bike ride would be great on these roads which were in really good condition. I checked online and saw there there were decent hotels few kilometers from mukteshwar.

title: Nice views near the temple
review: The temple is a simple one at the top of the hill. and the drive to it is great and the walk from a point to the temple is quite nice. easy walk with a great view point. We spent a day driving around Ramgarh and Mukteshwar and it was a pretty drive.It had just snowed a week ago and there was snow all over. the drive to the temple gave us great views of the himalayas. we started this drive from nainital. We had a great driver plus guide Mr. Haseem Khan with us who was very nice and gave us a lot of info and drove very well. Message me for his number if you plan to travel around nainital and the lakes.

title: Lord Shiva
review: The temple is situated across greenery around 100 KMs from Nainital and having the temple on a hill with amazing landscape on all the sides, do not forget to take warm clothes.

title: beautiful view and very charming
review: you have to climb more than 100 stairs but the temple is at a beautiful spot. It's very windy here so be prepared. Great view everywhere with snow view. don't carry any eatables in hand because monkeys are present

title: Must visit  in Mukteshwar
review: Situated at some height it is a b,ful temple with idols of different Gods.We tracked from the PWD inspection bungalow which was quite enjoyable  though one can climb from the main road also.While in Mukteshawar one has to  visit this temple.The location is good in the midst of devdar trees.

title: Temple
review: Small temple at the backdrop of mountains..Need to climb nearly 96 steps to reach!!Local guides will surround you the moment you alight from your vehicle..but no need to avail these, as there is not much the guide can show you additionally..

title: A must see
review: The journey to this temple is very pulsating. The view from the temple is excellent. Go in a clear day to witness the mountain ranges from temple.

title: A Temple on Hills
review: Excellent place with ultimate serenity. The rock cuts temple is just the most beautiful place to visit. It is near to Almora. The route really have a good scenic beauty.

title: Unforgettable
review: The small track within from the jungle to reach the temple is really awesome. I strongly recommend to take that route instead of the stairs. It is advisable to hire a guide.

title: Peaceful
review: Great place , very peaceful and do spend some time with the babaji who lives there. The view from the back side is quite nice and if you go at a odd hour you will find it absolutely quite for a great meditation session.

title: visit for views only
review: the forest walk up to the temple from Sitla was amazing as it was quiet, not many walkers and filled with bird sounds.

title: surrounded with fragrant trees
review: It is situated at the highest position in that area surrounded with high Fragrant trees. The natural beauty attracts to sit in natural environment and stay in quite.

title: A must see !!
review: This is a must see in Kumaon visit, one of the best places in Kumaon, stunning view of Himalayas, nice walking trail...

title: nice but very high climbing...
review: it was realy nice but height did bothered my breathing...people with breathing problem are suggested not to attempt...

title: Divine experience
review: A must visit if you are in the area. The walk to the temple and the temple itself is just amazing. Make sure you book a reliable guide.

title: old shiva temple
