review: its an ancient shiva temple located over a mountain about 50 kms from nainital, it is very old temple of lord shiva and it is told that pandavas also came here in their time, there is also some rock formations nearby called as 'chauli ki jaali' which is also a tourist attraction, the guide told that some religious celebration is carried out during Mahashivratri festival when the couples who are unable to conceive gather on this occasion do the worship and are blessed with child by God's grace, this is the religious belief of this area according to the guide

title: Breathtaking views
review: it is a good idea to stay at one of the resorts near Mukteshwar temple for one or two nights and spend around 2 nights at Nainital.

title: Om namah shivaye
review: place is famous for its old shiva temple..its small but very beautiful and awesum location , even drive to the temple is also very good if you are a long drive lover .

title: best location at hight
review: best on-the-way scenery and cool place even in summer. clam place at temple. do not take any guide who fools you for climbing temple.

title: nice view of valley
review: I am not very religious type but went there as the temple premises offer a stunning view of the valley and mountains. as You climb up to stairs to the temple, go to its right side and prepare to be mesmerized.

title: Spirituality reinforced
review: I would like to admit this is the second spiritual/ religious place after patal bhubneshwar in kumaun region that has made my belief on Hinduism stronger. When we visit a place like mukteshwar temple and witnesse people there worshipping with utmost faith, having conversation with Bengali baba, and just feel the purity of premises, it feels so empowered about Hinduism and the beliefs we have. First and foremost the location of temple is itself a place to be, then those epic stories associated with the temple and hearing them from bengali baba makes them so exciting.

title: Not worth visiting
review: Mukteshwar is exact 51 kms from nainital. And there is nothing there to see.temple is very very ordinary and view is not great also.it will take one whole day to visit but it will be very exhausting.dont waste time, truly nothing to see

title: Very good & clean lord shiva temple
review: It is located at a very good location. Temperature there is low as compared to Nainital. Very peaceful place. It tooks just a few steps to reach the temple. Lots of Devdar trees at this location. Very beautiful place.

title: Nice Shiva Temple
review: It is a nice Shiva temple with great scenic in the way to chaukori. The water area is full of fishes which is another attraction to watch for. The structure, walk to the temple is very scenic.

title: Only for Spiritual Purpose
review: If you are going there to have some fun, this could be avaided as the journey from Nainital to this place is quite tiresome. It took us some 2:30 hours to reach this place, though roads are not that bad but its hectic. Once you reach, there is a steep climb uphil to the temple and there is only one small eating joint nearby which only serves maggi. Could be simply avoided if this is a fun trip.

title: Aewsome trip
review: On the way to temple we came across Snow Fall and it was great. Though it was cloudy and so we were not able to see the Himalayan ranges, which the guide told can be seen easily on sunny day.

title: Un believable
review: Well u can say the view and the road to mukteshwar from nainital u can't describe u have to go there believe me its out of the world  u will feel peace of mind

title: Serene, calm and a fantastic location
review: Oh what a location, a walk through the forests in the snow clad hills, one really has to go there once to see the beauty of it. The temple seemed an ancient piece of art, but the location of the temple is awesome. Very beautiful place.

title: real temple
review: on the way from nainitaal to mukteshwar u will find apple orchards beautiful natural views and temple is like real god's house one must visit mukteshwar

title: peace at top
review: a bird's eye view from the temple ...sunset with its mystic light on the surrounding mountain range and a very quite sojourn

title: Green, serene, far from the crowds
review: Apart from offering a good view of the glaciers, Makteshwar can make you deeply peaceful, relaxed. The temple is ancient and the priests are very friendly, co-operative.

title: Peace and nature a its best !!
review: I have been to Mukteshwar with my friends and family in April month. The journey to this place is very interesting. Lot of beautiful views on the way to the Mukteshwar temple. We visited this place in the evening so were not able to capture the view from the top. Reached in the temple around 7PM and had a glimpse of the wonderful sunset from the top.Its almost 60KM from Nainital and the road is quite good. However, Its recommended to visit Mukteshwar during the day time to see the scenic beauty it has. There is very nice and peaceful environment in the Lord Shiva's temple which is situated at the top of the hill. A must visit.

title: peaceful place and still unexplored
review: the reason we love mukteshwar was that it is still fully unexplored so is free of the hustle bustle of so called hill stations like shimla and nainital... its not much crowded, you can take a stroll on the roads and you will not be disturbed by the ongoing traffic as there is rarely any traffic.. must visit place for nature lovers..

title: Done with Chauli ki Jaali..
review: Not much to do..here...one of the oldest temples..and lot of local following..chauli ki jaali and both are at the same location.

title: Superb
review: The temple itself is great. Do hire a guide to take you to a small jungle trek to take you to the temple. You get great views through the jungle.

title: Peace in the nature's lap
review: excellent location which is not too much crowded, mere just seeing the mountains gives a feel a meditation.

title: very high in the hills
review: Takes a good effort to reach the Temple. But once up the its beautiful. The views are amazing so is the cool climate and the breeze.

title: A must Visit
review: A very calm & peaceful place is Mahadev Temple at Mukteshwar. Much higher in altitude than Nainital is a perfect place to see the himalyas. It is 60 kms from nainital. But careful, this place is colder & chilly than Naintal. Few stairs to climb. Its a wonderful place. Without this, our trip was incomplete.

title: Beautiful location
review: Mukteshwar is about one and half hours drive from Nainital. The location was exotic and provided excellent views of the valley. The Shivji Mandir is located in a small hillock which took 15 minutes to reach walking in a slow pace. The mandir was small. the Shivlingam was small and beautiful. We heard that the mandir has been there since about 350 years The panditji was supportive and did pooja and prayers for us. There were small temples of other deities as well. We sat in the temple for about 20 minutes in silence. Enjoyed this day trip from Nainital.

title: spiritual !
review: Nice Hilltop shiva temple! a milestone which cannot be missed along with a visit /trek to IVRI ,Mukteshwar

title: scenic beauty
review: Mukteshwar temple is as much a relgious place to visit as it is a beauty of nature. The view is breathtaking and the effect is mesmerizing.

title: Wild and lonely
review: The Mukteshwar temple can be reached by a straight forward staircase. We took a guide to trek up the side of the hill, and it was definitely wild. The temperature reached near zero, and the skies clouded over. We went up a narrow steep hill side track dense with deodar and fir forest and spotted sambar deer tracks going down the hill side crossing this track. Some of the trees are more than 100 years old. It was as good as going for a wildlife sanctuary visit. The sun's glinting rays through the forest was brilliant.

title: nature rich mukteshwar
review: we visited the mukateshwar temple while going to kasouni from almora it is at height more than 4500 ft above mean sea level It is quite cool place and rich with nature you can see grate snow caped range of himalaya from chokhamba from west to nandadevi to east. the temple dedicated to lord shiva and large view of lower tarai hill and beauty is much enjoyable there n number of hotel in vide range right from star hotel to budget places

title: Himalayan view is best in Kumaon.
review: Himalayan view is best in Kumaon. No good place to stay near the view point. Can go for a short trip.

title: Excellent view from the cliff
review: Though it's a very tiring journey but beauty while driving from nainital to Mukteshwar, it is rewarding.

title: wonderful experience
review: wonderful place to be even though it was crowded when we went, but felt so much relaxed being there. it was very peaceful and soothing while I was there.

title: look for the rocks!
review: if you look from the temple, you can see some nice big rocks which are located such that they protrude into/over the abyss. it is an amazing photo-op place. we took many pics here and it is a must visit place.

title: Excellent Place to be
review: I have been to Mukteshwar for more than 3 times last year and was recently visited the place on new year eve with my friend.It is situated at an altitude of 2055 Meters which is equivalent to 7500 ft approx. This is a great destination out from crowd and one can stay alone, and in peace. The Himalayan view is great and one can see various peaks on clear day. Best time to visit is in September as the rainy season blocks the view of Great Himalayan Range. If you love bird watching it is a wonderful place to follow your hobby. Overall a wonderful place i must say a hidden treasure.

title: Serene, peaceful and soulful destination
review: If you love Deodar forest, want to watch Himalayas ..from a height of 2055 mtrs, enjoy the sound of trees and chirping birds ..this is the place to be..Journey to this place is more enjoyable then the destination..

title: This temple saves trees
review: The temple is on a height which can be climbed if you are patient and take it easy. You find it is worth it. The temple is surrounded with lot of green trees and give breath taking views of the valley below.

title: the serene temple
review: the temple is located in a peaceful hill around 60 kms from nainital. there is nothing in mukteshwar other than this temple. so make your trip carefully and dont come under the persuasion of the tour guides that this place has a number of tourist attractions. the temple is old but good.

title: Mukteshwar
review: Temple is small but view from Mukteshwar is great and is a scenic place.Dont miss out on the walk in the woods.You can get a guide for 100 rs .

title: Very nice.
review: Very nice hill station. With tea garden and orchards on the way from nainital.

title: Temple surrounded by hills and forest
review: Small temple on top of hill. Has a jungle route other than the normal steps leading to the temple. This gives one a chance to walk thro' the thick mountainside forest and also see a cliff view of the valley and surrounding mountain. Shiva temple.. you could expect some peace and quite here if it is not very crowded

title: Devdar covered
review: The temple of shiv is a spiritual place, which is covered by devdar trees all over. The place is highest height at Mukteshwar. A good place to visit and there also lives a Sadhu.

title: A must visit place if you love history, himalaya and scenic journey
review: Historical importance - As per saying, Pandava established a Shivalinga here while in exile.

title: Great Views
review: Monsson is best time to see sunset in Mukteshwar.Seems as at one corner of horizon sth is smouldering and its crimson lights are scattered all over sky..very holy scene  at that moment if you are at temple  one can imagine how one can feel about this temple and place.  Temple is situated on high altitude point .

title: Good Location
review: Mukteshwar is a must visit for people visiting Nainital.

title: Enjoy the nature at Hill top
review: It's not just temple to visit at Mukteshwar, there are so many things to enjoy. It was cold there even in mid May. If you're going there for first, it's good to have guide. They take Rs. 100/- and take you to the temple via forest. In between, there are beautiful rocks. Take some photographs and forest was just awesome.

title: Great shiva temple
review: It is very old shiva temple located in the midst of the forest and the views from here is fantastic and amazing and unforgettable.

title: Excellent View point, but far away....
review: We visited this place as per advice of one of the manager of our Hotel. He described it as far better place than Ranikhet. It is nearly 55 Kms distance from Nainital and road is tough for traveling being continuous left - right curves in the hills. We enjoyed scenic beauty of the hilly area on the way. Mukteshwar Temple was not great. It was a SAMADHI Mandir of one of the Saint with small temples of different gods around. Frankly speaking I will not recommend this place to visit as it is 55 kms away from Nainital and nothing great to enjoy other than panoramic view of hills around. We visited there in april third week and there was no snow arround. During winter view might be different.

title: Good enroute view
review: the temple is just ok..but the route from Nainital to mukteshwar is too good...drving skills at its best..good scenic views and can actully see himalayas from mukteshwar...
